snippet: “Rumble,” Rashid Johnson’s solo show at Hauser & Wirth, was partly inspired by that gallery’s town house, which once belonged to the boxing promoter Don King, organizer of the 1974 “Rumble in the Jungle” heavyweight fight.
abstract: Roberta Smith reviews works by Rashid Johnson at Hauser & Wirth gallery.
lead_paragraph: “Rumble,” Rashid Johnson’s solo show at Hauser & Wirth, was partly inspired by that gallery’s town house, which once belonged to the boxing promoter Don King, organizer of the 1974 “Rumble in the Jungle” heavyweight fight.
